definition: to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...

sentences.english: The trend in the Arab world leans towards aridity.
sentences.chinese: 這個在阿拉伯世界的趨勢將趨向於乾燥。

sentences.english: This suggests that state acquirers tend to have a stronger tunneling incentive.
sentences.chinese: 這表明國有收購方有更強的激勵趨向於操作隧道挖掘。

sentences.english: Americans on the go also tend to eat a lot of "junkfood.
sentences.chinese: 忙碌的美國人也趨向於喫一大堆“垃圾食物”。

sentences.english: The totality of the purposefulness of that which we are, which transcends consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 那趨向完滿的我們的內在本質，它超越了意識。

sentences.english: Women’s weekly magazines tend to rely utterly on news-stand sales.
sentences.chinese: 婦女週刊趨向於全部依靠報攤的銷售額。

sentences.english: The realities of the hardware, then, are sculpted to best support that paradigm.
sentences.chinese: 於是硬件的設計就趨向對這種範式進行最好的支持。

sentences.english: However government interests - often suspect - tend to over-ride such concerns.
sentences.chinese: 不過，政府利益趨向於淹沒這些疑問。

sentences.english: My contention is that financial markets tend towards these strange attractors not to equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 我的論點是金融市場趨向這些奇怪的引資者不平衡。

sentences.english: In a globalized world, beauty standards tend to merge.
sentences.chinese: 在全球化的現在，美的標準趨向一統。

sentences.english: The extensional meaning of compound directional complement has its cognitive basis.
sentences.chinese: 複合趨向補語的引申意義有其認知上的理據。

sentences.english: The development of pesticide industry in the world tends to be more centralized and more monopolized.
sentences.chinese: 世界農藥工業的發展趨向於更加集中，更加壟斷。

sentences.english: The views of the left wing have tended to predominate within the party.
sentences.chinese: 左翼的觀點趨向於在該黨黨內佔支配地位。

sentences.english: The differentiation tendencies and immunofeatures of neoplastic myoepithelial cells were discussed.
sentences.chinese: 討論了腫瘤性肌上皮細胞的分化趨向和免疫特性。

sentences.english: He was not yet sealed in righteousness even though his inclination was toward the good.
sentences.chinese: 他還沒有得到義的印記，雖然他的性格趨向於善。

sentences.english: ATHLETES are turning to a new performance-enhancing drug: Viagra.
sentences.chinese: 運動員趨向應用萬艾可來提高成績。

sentences.english: The evolution and trend of human-earth system coupling relation.
sentences.chinese: 人地系統耦合關係演變及趨向。

definition: to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
aspect/facet/level (political, psychological, spiritual etc)/(geology) bedding plane
variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]/to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
whole entity/entire body/synthesis/as a whole (situation, construction, team etc)/global/macrocosm/integral/holistic/whole
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
